Comments_List: We learned a lot about various fields through reading recent papers and discussing them with faculty and students. We presented an experiment and wrote a detailed abstract which helped with our experiment development skills.
I learned how to critically evaluate research articles from outside fields.

Strengths: Only having to read two papers a week makes the class manageable and allows you to put more effort into reading the papers well. 
Weaknesses: Student and faculty discussion skills are varying which makes it hard to have full discussions without the question:answer formula often used by teachers.

A strength was the student only discussion session before we had the faculty discussion. I thought the faculty discussions were best when we didn't go around in a circle to describe figures, but actually talked about and discussed the paper.
Yes because it connects interdisciplinary fields well and exposes students to new methods not typically covered in department specific discussions.
Yes, I think this course was both interesting and beneficial in terms of critical thinking skills. It was also a good way to be exposed to research out of your own field.
